FuncDef:
The client acl command configures an ACL rule referenced by TWAMP.
The undo client acl command cancels an ACL rule referenced by TWAMP.
By default, no ACL rule referenced by TWAMP is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a basic ACL number referenced by TWAMP.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies an advanced ACL number referenced by TWAMP.
The value is an integer ranging from 3000 to 3999.

Specifies an ACL name referenced by TWAMP.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The value must start with a letter (a to z or A to Z, case sensitive).

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a restriction on client access to a TWAMP server, run the client acl command to configure an ACL rule referenced by TWAMP.
